criteria: Accuracy of Self-Assessment: How accurately does the student identify their current physical activity levels?
Understanding of Physical Activity Guidelines: Does the student understand the recommended physical activity guidelines for their age group?
Application of Assessment to Personal Goals: How well does the student use their assessment to set realistic and achievable physical activity goals?
descriptions: Student shows no awareness of their physical activity levels or provides completely inaccurate information.
Student demonstrates a minimal understanding of their physical activity, with significant inaccuracies.
Student identifies some aspects of their physical activity levels but misses key components or provides somewhat inaccurate information.
Student provides a generally accurate assessment of their physical activity levels, with minor omissions or inaccuracies.
Student provides a comprehensive and accurate assessment of their physical activity levels, demonstrating a good understanding of their habits.
Student provides an exceptionally thorough and precise self-assessment, showing deep insight into their physical activity patterns and incorporating data or specific examples.
Student shows no understanding of physical activity guidelines.
Student demonstrates a very limited awareness of physical activity guidelines.
Student can recall some basic physical activity recommendations but struggles to apply them to their own life.
Student generally understands physical activity guidelines and can relate them to their own activity levels.
Student demonstrates a strong understanding of physical activity guidelines and can explain their importance and relevance.
Student exhibits mastery of physical activity guidelines, articulating nuanced recommendations and demonstrating the ability to adapt guidelines to individual needs.
Student does not attempt to connect their assessment to any personal goals.
Student mentions goals but does not show how they relate to their assessment.
Student sets vague goals that are loosely related to their assessment of physical activity.
Student sets somewhat specific goals related to their assessment, but these goals may not be fully realistic or achievable.
Student sets realistic and achievable goals based on their assessment, showing a clear plan for improvement.
Student sets highly specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, and time-bound (SMART) goals, demonstrating a sophisticated understanding of how to use self-assessment for self-improvement.
